attributes.action: Review Uber's new pricing, commission and promotions structure.
attributes.additional_details:
During the pandemic, we stood by our cities, its residents and Uber to carry on providing essential services to essential workers at great personal risk to ourselves and loved ones.

This makes us the essential worker's essential worker yet our fresh contributions to this crisis have already been forgotten.

Whilst costs have gone up year on year, fare prices haven't increased since 2014.

We face daily violence, discrimination, aggression and often get locked out app without due diligence.
attributes.background:
We ask that the government puts pressure on Uber to  launch an independent review into it's new pricing/offers, commission structure and fixed pricing. 

We ask that matters are properly investigated by relevant authorities when drivers face accusations.

rejection.details: The commercial structure of Uber is a matter for its board, not the Government or House of Commons, and we cannot accept petitions that call for an action relating to a particular individual, or organisation outside of the UK Government or Parliament.
